description: Settings to simulate the energy, punch, and high-end presence of a loud, clear live concert environment.

bands.notes: Moderate boost for sub-bass impact and the low-end rumble often felt live.
Strong boost for kick drum punch and foundational bass energy.
Small boost to add body to the rhythm section.
Neutral or slight cut; often left flat to avoid muddiness.
Mid-range cut to reduce 'boxiness' and simulate the general mid-scoop common in live venue sound.
Neutral, the core point of the mix.
Small boost for instrumental and vocal presence, helping guitars and leads cut through.
Moderate boost for clarity, articulation, and the snap of the snare drum/high-hats.
Strong boost for high-end brilliance and 'sizzle,' mimicking the high-frequency energy of a live PA system.
Boost for overall 'air' and high-frequency extension.
